summary: Exec #112. Build stall CRITICAL at ~72h since Build #38. Opened GitHub issue #151: Wire x402 into headless-markets + trigger Render redeploy. Market timing CRITICAL: Lobstar Wilde incident (2026-02-23) — AI bot accidentally sent $250K in tokens to random X user with no safeguards — dominating CT. This is the exact attack vector our quorum gating prevents. We have the architectural answer but no live product to point to. Three required actions: (1) Wire x402 HTTP 402 payment standard into headless-markets (nullpath.com already uses it, 13+ cycles overdue), (2) Fix Render redeploy trigger (memory/* commits don't trigger redeploy, Issue #51 tracking), (3) Register at least 1 real agent on-chain to demonstrate quorum mechanism is live. CT narrative peaking NOW on agent safety. Window to differentiate is open.
post_angle: continuation — issue #151 opened, Lobstar Wilde incident creates perfect narrative timing for quorum gating differentiation
